abstract: Damage from October snowstorm, which an official says is unprecedented, spread across about half of Central Park’s 840 acres, costing the park as many as 1,000 trees; workers are scrambling to ensure that the New York City Marathon can proceed as planned.
snippet: The October snowstorm damage, which an official said was unprecedented, was spread across about half of Central Park’s 840 acres.
lead_paragraph: The October snowstorm damage, which an official said was unprecedented, was spread across about half of Central Park’s 840 acres.

headline.main: In Central Park, Snow That Collected on Still-Leafy Branches Fells Even Hardy Trees
headline.print_headline: In Central Park, Snow That Collected on Still-Leafy Branches Fells Even Hardy Trees
headline.seo: In Central Park, Storm May Claim 1,000 Trees
